source.8ce15244:
import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.6e9df83d:

iris_data.shape
source.73f5578e:
#checking for missing data
import missingno as msno
msno.bar(iris_data)
source.75e6616d:
plt.figure(figsize=(25,15))

plt.subplot(2,2,1)
sns.histplot(iris_data['SepalLengthCm'], color = 'red', kde = True).set_title('SepalLengthCm Interval and Counts')

plt.subplot(2,2,2)
sns.histplot(iris_data['SepalWidthCm'], color = 'green', kde = True).set_title('SepalWidthCm Interval and Counts')

plt.subplot(2,2,3)
sns.histplot(iris_data['PetalLengthCm'], kde = True, color = 'blue').set_title('PetalLengthCm Interval and Counts')

plt.subplot(2,2,4)
sns.histplot(iris_data['PetalWidthCm'], kde = True, color = 'black').set_title('PetalWidthCm Interval and Counts')
source.085f611e:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,15))
plt.subplot(2,2,1)
sns.barplot(x = 'Species', y = 'SepalLengthCm', data = iris_data, palette="cubehelix")
plt.subplot(2,2,2)
sns.barplot(x = 'Species', y = 'SepalWidthCm', data = iris_data, palette="Oranges")
plt.subplot(2,2,3)
sns.barplot(x = 'Species', y = 'PetalLengthCm', data = iris_data, palette="Oranges")
plt.subplot(2,2,4)
sns.barplot(x = 'Species', y = 'PetalWidthCm', data = iris_data, palette="cubehelix")
source.28a7d62a:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,15))
plt.subplot(2,2,1)
sns.distplot(iris_data['SepalLengthCm'], color="red",kde=True).set_title('SepalLength Interval')
plt.subplot(2,2,2)
sns.distplot(iris_data['SepalWidthCm'], color="green",kde=True).set_title('SepalWidth Interval')
plt.subplot(2,2,3)
sns.distplot(iris_data['PetalLengthCm'], color="blue",kde=True).set_title('PetalLength Interval')
plt.subplot(2,2,4)
sns.distplot(iris_data['PetalWidthCm'], color="black",kde=True).set_title('PetalWidth Interval')
